title: [feature request] Add option for only computing the singular values of a matrix
body_html:
🚀 Feature

I would like to propose the addition of an option to the current SVD implementation analogous to compute_uv in NumPy's SVD which will compute the singular values of a the matrix only.

Pitch

>>> torch.svd(a, compute_uv=False)
<tensor containing singular values>
>>> torch.svd(a, compute_uv=True)
<3-tuple standard output>

Methods that depend only on singular values such as matrix_rank and nuclear_norm will benefit from this addition.

body:
## 🚀 Feature
I would like to propose the addition of an option to the current SVD implementation analogous to `compute_uv` in NumPy's SVD which will compute the singular values of a the matrix only.

## Pitch

```python
>>> torch.svd(a, compute_uv=False)
<tensor containing singular values>
>>> torch.svd(a, compute_uv=True)
<3-tuple standard output>
```

Methods that depend only on singular values such as `matrix_rank` and `nuclear_norm` will benefit from this addition.
